TextJPN: 私は、この村の守り神ですから…。
TextENG: Because I'm the guardian god of this village...

TextJPN: 待ち合わせ場所では、やはりレナと魅音が先に到着して、俺を待ってくれていた。
TextENG: Rena and Mion had already arrived at the meeting spot and were waiting for me.

TextJPN: 「あはははは！@k@vS14/02/220200141.　圭一くん、早く早く～！」
TextENG: ``Ahahahaha!@k@vS14/02/220200141. Keiichi-kun, hurry up~!``

TextJPN: 「もう、圭ちゃん遅いぞー！」
TextENG: ``You're late, Kei-chan!``

TextJPN: 「はいカウント５秒前～、３、２、１…」
TextENG: ``Alright, five-second countdown~. Three, two, one...``

TextJPN: 「ぬ、ぬおおぉぉおぉ～～～ッッ！！」
TextENG: ``Wh-whoaaaa~~~!!``

TextJPN: ペダルに力を込めて、一気に加速。そして疾風のごとく二人の間を抜き去って…、ハンドルを右に回してイナーシャルドリフトぉぉおぉッッ！！
TextENG: I focused on the pedals and accelerated at once. And then I passed between the two of them like a swift breeze... and cranked the handle to the right to slide into a driiift!!

TextJPN: どんがらがっしゃんしゃ～～んっっ！！
TextENG: *slam* *rattle* *rattle*

TextJPN: 「け、圭一くん大丈夫っ？！」
TextENG: ``K-Keiichi-kun, are you all right?!``

TextJPN: 「う、う～む…、@k@vS14/01/220100400.やっぱり自転車で反転ドリフトは厳しかったか…、@k@vS14/01/220100401.あ、あててっ！」
TextENG: ``Y-yeah~...@k@vS14/01/220100400. I guess a drift reversal was too much to handle on a bike...@k@vS14/01/220100401. Ah, ow ow!``

TextJPN: 「はぁ、全く何やってるのさ…@k@vS14/03/220300296.ほら、つかまって！」
TextENG: ``Haah. Honestly, what are you doing...?@k@vS14/03/220300296. Here, grab on!``

TextJPN: 魅音の差し出した手を掴んで、腰と背中についた土を払いながら立ち上がる。…ちょっとだけ体のあちこちがひりひりと痛んだが、不思議と怪我はひとつもなかった。
TextENG: I grabbed Mion's outstretched hand and rose to my feet while wiping the dirt from my waist and back. ...My body ached in a couple places, but oddly enough, there were no actual injuries.

TextJPN: 「そのかわりに、自転車が御臨終だよ。@k@vS14/03/220300298.…どうすんの、これ？」
TextENG: ``But that bike, on the other hand, is totally dead.@k@vS14/03/220300298. ...What are you going to do with this?``

TextJPN: 呆れた顔でそう言いながら、魅音は俺の自転車をよいしょ、と起こしてみせる。
TextENG: Mion had a stunned look on her face as she lifted my bike back up.

TextJPN: …思い切り転んだおかげで俺の愛車はチェーンが切れ、ブレーキも前輪がほとんど効かない。かごは壊れ、スポークは抜け…まぁ、大破というやつだろうか。
TextENG: ...The chain had snapped off in the heavy fall, and the brakes hardly looked like they'd work on the front wheel. The front basket was broken, and a few spokes were missing... Man, it was a total wreck.

TextJPN: 「だいたいね～、圭ちゃんはやることに無茶が多すぎるんだよ。@k@vS14/03/220300300.せっかく怪我が部活メンバーで一番早く治ったのに、校長先生に戦いを挑んだりしてさ～！」
TextENG: ``Seriously, Kei-chan, you take things way too far.@k@vS14/03/220300300. Even if you're the club member that healed the fastest, that doesn't mean you should go challenging the principal to a battle~!``

TextJPN: 「その罰ゲームを考えたのはお前だろ魅音っ！」
TextENG: ``You were the one who thought up that punishment, Mion!``

TextJPN: 「あはははは！@k@vS14/02/220200144.　でも校長先生感心してたよね！@k@vS14/02/220200145.『自分の服にかすったやつは、戦後になって君で２人目だ』なんて言ってくれたでしょ？@k@vS14/02/220200146.　さっすが部長さんだよね～？」
TextENG: ``Ahahahaha!@k@vS14/02/220200144. But the principal seemed impressed!@k@vS14/02/220200145. He said ``You're only the second one since the war to challenge me dressed like that.``@k@vS14/02/220200146. That's our club leader, right~?``

TextJPN: …その代償はとびきりでかかったけどな。
TextENG: ...That was an excessive price to pay, though.

TextJPN: 「おうよ！@k@vS14/01/220100404.　これから俺のことを、世紀末覇王と呼ぶがいい！！」
TextENG: ``Yeah!@k@vS14/01/220100404. From now on, you can call me King of the End of the Century!!``

TextJPN: 「…新しい世紀が来るのはまだまだ先だよ。@k@vS14/03/220300302.その前に人間やめちゃうほうに、私は一生分の時間を賭けてもいいね」
TextENG: ``...The new century is still a long ways out.@k@vS14/03/220300302. I'd bet my whole life that I'd abandon my humanity before that ever happened.``
``Huh? Huuuh?!@k@vS14/02/220200148. So that means if you stay human...@k@vS14/02/220200149. You'll get married?!``

TextJPN: 「なっ？！@k@vS14/03/220300304.　ななななな、なぁぁんで、そうなるかこの耳年増はぁぁあぁっっ？！」
TextENG: ``Wha?!@k@vS14/03/220300304. H-h-h-h-hooow could it be, you Miss know-it-alllll?!``

TextJPN: 魅音は顔面真っ赤になって、レナを追い回す。それをきゃいきゃいと逃げ回りながら、レナは妄想全開モードではやし立てる。
TextENG: Mion turned red and chased after Rena. Rena had gone full power into daydream mode as she cheerfully ran circles away from her.

TextJPN: …最近レナは詩音と遊ぶことが増えたせいで、覚える必要のない、むしろさっさと忘れろ！　ってな知識をつけて、暴走度が格段にグレードアップしていた。
TextENG: ...Rena has been hanging out with Shion more often lately, and she has no need to learn the things she's teaching. In fact, she would be better off forgetting! But with that knowledge, her ability to get carried away in her fantasies had been significantly upgraded.

TextJPN: 純真無垢、…だったとは言わないが、それでも悪意がなかった以前と比べれば、その破壊力と凶悪度はもはや比較することすら恐ろしいほどだ。
TextENG: I wouldn't say she was pure before... but her violent destructive power is far more terrifying now than it was when she was less malicious.

TextJPN: 園崎詩音と竜宮レナ。…最強というより最凶のタッグ結成を止められなかったことが、今後の暮らしにどれだけの影響を及ぼすことになるか…今は考えないでおこう。というか考えたくもない。
TextENG: Shion Sonozaki and Rena Ryuugu. ...I have no idea just how much my life will be impacted by my inability to stop the formation of the strongest, most evil tag-team duo in history. I didn't even want to think about it.

TextJPN: 「ほらっ！　さっさと行くよ、レナ！@k@vS14/03/220300306.　圭ちゃんも準備して！」
TextENG: ``Come on! We need to get going, Rena!@k@vS14/03/220300306. You too, Kei-chan! Get ready!``

TextJPN: 「あ、いや…そうしたいのは山々だが、@k@vS14/01/220100406.自転車がこの状態じゃにんともかんとも…」
TextENG: ``Oh, well... I really do want to get going...@k@vS14/01/220100406. but with my bike like this...``

TextJPN: 「あ、そうか。@k@vS14/03/220300308.…仕方ないなぁ、それじゃ、私と二人乗りで――」
TextENG: ``Oh, right.@k@vS14/03/220300308. ...Then we've got no choice. You're riding with me...``

TextJPN: 「はう～、二人乗り？！@k@vS14/02/220200151.　いいないいなそれ～！@k@vS14/02/220200152.　圭一くんが運転して～、魅ぃちゃんが後ろで～！@k@vS14/02/220200153.　背中と胸がごっつんこ☆　はうはうぅ～♪」
TextENG: ``Hau~, riding together?!@k@vS14/02/220200151. Isn't that lovely~!@k@vS14/02/220200152. With Keiichi-kun driving~, and Mii-chan behind him~!@k@vS14/02/220200153. With her chest against his back☆. Hau, hauu~♪.``

TextJPN: 「～～～～～、さっ、先に行くよ！@k@vS14/03/220300310.　圭ちゃんは走っておいで、じゃっ！！」
TextENG: ``~~~~~, I-I'm going on ahead!@k@vS14/03/220300310. Kei-chan, you're just gonna have to run, see ya!!``

TextJPN: 「おいっ！　俺は徒歩か？！@k@vS14/01/220100408.　そのスピードで走れってかぁっ？！@k@vS14/01/220100409.　おぉ～い！！」
TextENG: ``Hold on! You want me to go on foot?!@k@vS14/01/220100408. You think I can run that fast?!@k@vS14/01/220100409. Heeey~!!``

TextJPN: ――それは、ずっとずっと、夢見ていた未来。
TextENG: ...This is the future we always dreamed of.

TextJPN: 毎日が楽しくて、賑やかで。
TextENG: Having fun, lively experiences every single day.

TextJPN: 明日が来るのが待ち遠しくて眠れなかった、幸せな時間。
TextENG: A happy time, when we're looking forward to tomorrow so much we can't sleep.
``...Oh, they're here!@k@vS14/06/220600293. Hey, over here~!``

TextJPN: 待ちかねたのか、神社の入り口には詩音と沙都子、そして梨花ちゃんがいた。
TextENG: Shion, Satoko, and Rika-chan were impatiently waiting for us at the entrance to the shrine.

TextJPN: 「やっほー、詩ぃちゃん♪@k@vS14/02/220200157.　今日もいい天気だね～！」
TextENG: ``Yoo-hoo, Shii-chan♪.@k@vS14/02/220200157. Fine weather we're having today~!``

TextJPN: 「…今日の集まりには詩音は呼んでないはずだけど～？」
TextENG: ``...I thought Shion wasn't invited to today's gathering~?``

TextJPN: 「何を言ってるんですか。@k@vS14/06/220600295.沙都子の行くところ、保護者役のねーねーがいなくてどうしようっていうんですか？」
TextENG: ``What are you saying?@k@vS14/06/220600295. Satoko can't go anywhere without her Nee-nee acting as her guardian, right?``

TextJPN: 「私だって呼びたくありませんでしたが、@k@vS14/04/220400265.…梨花のおしゃべりが、べらっと」
TextENG: ``I didn't really want to invite her, but...@k@vS14/04/220400265. bigmouth Rika told her about it.``

TextJPN: 「…沙都子の明日からの昼食は、にんじんのグラッセとピーマンの肉詰めと…」
TextENG: ``...Satoko, starting tomorrow your lunch is going to include glazed carrots and meat-stuffed peppers...``

TextJPN: 「ねっ、ねーねーがいるほうがあのっ、@k@vS14/04/220400267.こういう場はと、とても楽しくてございましてよ！@k@vS14/04/220400268.　をーっほっほっほ！！」
TextENG: ``N-Nee-nee, having you around...@k@vS14/04/220400267. does make the place much more fun!@k@vS14/04/220400268. Oh ho ho ho!!``

TextJPN: …すっかりしつけられてるな、沙都子。そんな、顔で笑って心はルルルー涙の彼女の頭を、ぽん、と梨花ちゃんが撫でて慰めた。
TextENG: ...Satoko was completely under her control. Her heart was crying as she laughed and smiled, but Rika-chan gave her a pat on the head to comfort her.

TextJPN: 「生きていれば、きっといいことがあるはずなのです。@k@vS14/05/220500521.ふぁいと、おーなのですよ」
TextENG: ``If you're still alive, it means there must be something good about it.@k@vS14/05/220500521. Fight on.``

TextJPN: 「…そう思うなら、@k@vS14/04/220400270.せめてニヤニヤ笑いながら言うのは止めてくださいませんことっ？！」
TextENG: ``...If you believe that...@k@vS14/04/220400270. then at the very least, stop grinning as you say it, all right?!``

TextJPN: そして、魅音とレナから遅れること、数分と数秒。
TextENG: Then, I arrived several minutes or so after Mion and Rena.

TextJPN: 全身汗だくになって、ぜいぜいと荒い息をつきながら、ようやく俺は神社に到着することができた。
TextENG: My whole body was drenched in sweat and my breath was short, but I finally managed to reach the shrine.

TextJPN: 「…相変わらず時間にルーズな方ですわね、圭一さんは」
TextENG: ``...Your punctuality is as lacking as ever, Keiichi-san.``

TextJPN: 「ワープロ以下の学習機能なのです、にぱ～♪」
TextENG: ``His learning functions are weaker than a word processor. Nipah~♪.``

TextJPN: 「…なんで走ってきたんですか？」
TextENG: ``...Why did you run all the way here?``
``Is this training for your lower body?@k@vS14/06/220600299. Know what I mean, Sis?``

TextJPN: 「な・ん・で・も・な・い・のっ！！」
TextENG: ``NOT AT ALL!!``

TextJPN: 「…何怒ってるんです？」
TextENG: ``...Why are you getting so upset?``

TextJPN: 「…と、とりあえずな、なんか飲み物を…。@k@vS14/01/220100411.おお詩音、その麦茶もらいっ」
TextENG: ``...A-anyway, could I get something to drink...?@k@vS14/01/220100411. Oh, Shion, I'll take that barley tea you've got there!``
``Oh, this...?@k@vS14/06/220600302. It's broth for udon.``

TextJPN: ぶほっっ！！
TextENG: Bwah!!

TextJPN: 何気ない、日常の繰り返し。
TextENG: It was the typical, everyday cycle.

TextJPN: でも、いつでもどこでも、笑顔が絶えなくて。
TextENG: But no matter when, no matter where, they were always smiling.

TextJPN: 時間の過ぎるのが早すぎると思えるくらいに、中身がぎっしりと詰まった、素敵なひととき。
TextENG: Time seemed to move so fast, since it was so tightly packed with such wonderful moments.

TextJPN: 「…え～、というわけで。@k@vS14/01/220100413.昨日で梨花ちゃんの怪我が治って、部活メンバー全員が五体満足に立ち戻った快気祝いとして、@k@vS14/01/220100414.本日はささやかながらお祝いの昼食会を開きたいと思います！」
TextENG: ``...Uhh~, anyway.@k@vS14/01/220100413. Rika-chan's injuries have healed as of yesterday, so I'm pleased to announce that all the club members are now back to perfect health.@k@vS14/01/220100414. And so, I wanted to hold a small lunch today to celebrate!``

TextJPN: 「「おおおぉぉおぉ――ッッ！！！」」
一斉に割れんばかりの拍手が鳴り響き、部活メンバー…すなわちクラス全員の歓声が沸き起こる。
TextENG: Thunderous applause rang out all at once from the club members... along with the excited cheers of the entire class.

TextJPN: そしてめいめい、紙コップに酒…は未成年なので絶対厳禁としてジュースやサイダーを注ぎあい、氷を落として乾杯の準備を整えた。
TextENG: And, each one of them had a paper cup filled with alcohol... no, with juice or cider, because underage drinking is strictly prohibited. We dropped in some ice and prepared for a toast.

TextJPN: …あれから１週間が過ぎて、今日は７月最初の日曜日。
TextENG: ...One week had passed since then, and it was now the first Sunday in July.

TextJPN: あの事件の翌日、怪我だらけで登校してきた俺たちの姿を見るなり、当然のことながら大樹や傑たちクラスメイト、そして知恵先生は仰天して口々に心配の言葉をかけてくれた。
TextENG: The day after the incident, we found ourselves going to school despite all our injuries. Naturally, Daiki, Suguru, the other classmates, and Chie-sensei were all astounded and told us how concerned they were.

TextJPN: 俺たちはさすがに事情を話すわけにもいかず、とある部活を研究しているうちに怪我をしてしまったと笑いあい、そして普段の生活へと戻っていった。
TextENG: Of course, we couldn't really talk about the situation. We laughed it off as injuries we got while researching a certain club activity, and went back to life as usual.

TextJPN: とはいえ、さすがに梨花ちゃんは元気がなく、どう元気付けてあげようかと考えあぐねていたが。…翌日には元気に部活に参加して、なんと珍しく優勝を勝ち取ってみせて、みんなを驚かせた。
TextENG: Although, Rika-chan was understandably unenthused, and I was thinking about what I could do to cheer her up. But the next day, she cheerfully participated in club activities and everyone was surprised to see her claim total victory.

TextJPN: その帰り際、…心配して声をかけた俺に、梨花ちゃんは笑ってこう言った。
TextENG: On the way back home... I was worried about Rika-chan so I spoke to her, but she smiled as she spoke up.

TextJPN: 「――ボクが楽しく過ごせることが、羽入の一番望んでいたことなのです」
TextENG: ``...Hanyuu's greatest wish was for me to have a fun, enjoyable life.``

TextJPN: 「だからボクは、これからも一生懸命、笑っていこうと思うのですよ」
TextENG: ``That's why I'm going to work hard to keep on smiling.``

TextJPN: そんな梨花ちゃんを見て、…失礼だけど大人になったんだなと、俺は心から思った。
TextENG: Looking at Rika-chan like that... it might be rude of me to say, but deep down I felt like she had grown up.

TextJPN: 羽入が、それを望んだように…。
TextENG: Just as Hanyuu wanted...

TextJPN: …不思議なことに、羽入が鷹野さんをかばって、そして消えたところを目にした人は、俺と梨花ちゃん、そして鷹野さんを除いて誰もいなかった。
TextENG: ...Strangely enough, nobody actually saw Hanyuu protecting Takano-san aside from me, Rika-chan, and Takano-san herself.

TextJPN: 魅音たちの話だと、気がついたら鷹野さんが連行されるそのそばで、俺と梨花ちゃんが泣き崩れていたらしい。
TextENG: According to Mion and the others, they just noticed Rika-chan and me crying beside Takano-san as she was being taken away.

TextJPN: だから羽入のことは、…俺と梨花ちゃんだけでもずっと、覚えていこうと誓い合っていた――。
TextENG: That's why... Rika-chan and I vowed that we would always remember Hanyuu...

TextJPN: 「それでは、代表して我らが敬愛すべき担任、知恵先生に乾杯の音頭を取ってもらおうと思います！@k@vS14/01/220100416.　どうぞっ！！」
TextENG: ``And now, I'm going to let our dear teacher Chie-sensei lead the toast!@k@vS14/01/220100416. Go right ahead!!``

TextJPN: 「カレー万歳！！」
TextENG: ``Hooray, curry!!``
``...Cheers!!``

TextJPN: 「「ここでもカレーかぁぁあぁっっ！！！」」
TextENG: ````Curry?! Even heeeere!?!````

TextJPN: そして俺たちは、めいめい持ち合った弁当を広げて、わいわいと楽しく箸をつついては舌鼓を打ち合う。
TextENG: Then, we spread our lunches out in front of us, and happily shared them and feasted with our chopsticks.

TextJPN: やはり一番人気はレナスペシャルマークⅡ（本人命名）で、前々から目をつけていたのか下級生たちはそれに殺到し、その可愛らしさにレナ必殺の『お持ち帰りぃ～♪』が天下御免にまかり通っていた。
TextENG: Of course, the most popular meal was the (so called) Rena Trademark Special and the younger kids must have been eyeing it up, because they all immediately jumped on it. The cuteness of the kids invoked Rena's deadly ``I wanna take you home with mee~♪`` and it was smothering the entire world.

TextJPN: …まぁ、それ以外にも女の子たちから料理の作り方のレクチャーを頼まれたりして、本当に楽しそうだったのでよしとしよう。
TextENG: ...Well, aside from that, some of the girls were asking her to give a lecture on cooking, and she looked really joyful so we went for it.

TextJPN: …ボストンバッグに下級生を詰め込んだりしないか、帰りは荷物検査が必要だな。
TextENG: ...But I need to check her bags before she heads home to make sure she's not packing any of the junior students away in there.

TextJPN: ちなみに、最初はバーベキューにしよう、という提案もあったが、魅音の強硬な反対でそれは却下された。
TextENG: Incidentally, some people originally suggested that we have a barbecue today, but that plan got shot down by a flat-out rejection from Mion.

TextJPN: …まぁ、火を使う名目でまた大人たちが集まったら、今度は祝言の日取りとか新婚旅行の行き先とかまで聞かれかねない。
TextENG: ...Well, that's fine. If we allow the adults to gather again under the pretense of playing with fire, they might twist it into a celebration for the selection of our honeymoon destination.

TextJPN: ということで、…多数決の民主主義ではなく、ここは委員長の強権発動で弁当の持ち寄りと修正させてもらった。
TextENG: Which meant... this wasn't decided democratically, but by the power of the class rep calling for everyone to prepare lunch boxes.

TextJPN: …しかし、その後の『委員長、園崎さんにえこひいき～！』との詩音の扇動があって、しばらく教室内が騒然として収拾が大変面倒だったけど。
TextENG: ...But, then Shion stirred the class up with cheers that ``the class rep shows Sonozaki-san favorable treatment~!`` which caused a ruckus that took a long time to settle down.

TextJPN: そうそう、詩音といえば…。
TextENG: Oh right, speaking of Shion...

TextJPN: 「――詩音。@k@vS14/01/220100419.そういえば魅音から聞いたけど、お前看護学校受けるんだって？」
TextENG: ``...Shion.@k@vS14/01/220100419. By the way, I heard from Mion that you're planning to go to nursing school?``

TextJPN: 「ええ、来年ね。@k@vS14/06/220600304.…ちょうどいい機会だし、頑張ってみますよ」
TextENG: ``Yeah, starting next year.@k@vS14/06/220600304. ...It seems like a good opportunity, so I'll give it everything I've got.``

TextJPN: 詩音はそう言って、にやりと笑いながら紙コップを掲げてみせる。
TextENG: Shion raised her paper cup and grinned as she said that.

TextJPN: …おそらくそれは悟史のためなんだろうって、容易に想像がついた。
TextENG: ...It was easy to imagine she was pursuing that path for Satoshi's sake.

TextJPN: 「まぁ、それも確かにありますよ。@k@vS14/06/220600306.でも、それだけじゃないです」
TextENG: ``Well, that's certainly part of it.@k@vS14/06/220600306. But that's not all there is to it.``

TextJPN: 「誰かを傷つけるよりも、誰かを癒して、治してあげる仕事のほうがずっと楽しくてやりがいがあるって、ちょっと思えるようになってきましたので、ね」
TextENG: ``I've been doing some thinking, and I came to the conclusion that healing people is more fun and rewarding than hurting them. Don't you think?``

TextJPN: 「くっくっく！@k@vS14/03/220300316.　沙都子、気をつけなよ？@k@vS14/03/220300317.　さっさと病気を治さないと、いつかあんたの担当の看護師さんが詩音になるかもしれないよ～？」
TextENG: ``Heh heh heh!@k@vS14/03/220300316. Satoko, watch out.@k@vS14/03/220300317. If your illness isn't cured quickly, Shion might end up the nurse in charge of your care someday~!``

TextJPN: それを聞いて、沙都子の顔がムンクの叫びのように『ひぃぃいぃっ！！』とそれはもう派手に引きつった。
TextENG: Upon hearing that, Satoko's face twisted to resemble that painting The Scream, as she let out a flashy ``Eeeeek!!``

TextJPN: 「ふ、ふわぁぁあぁっ！！@k@vS14/04/220400275.　それは悪夢ですわっ！@k@vS14/04/220400276.　まさに生き地獄でございますわぁぁあぁっ～～！！」
TextENG: ``F-fwaaaaah!!@k@vS14/04/220400275. What a nightmare!@k@vS14/04/220400276. Such a thing would be a living hell~~!!``

TextJPN: 「ちょっと、沙都子！@k@vS14/06/220600309.　それはどういう意味ですか、ああんっ？！」
TextENG: ``Hold on, Satoko!@k@vS14/06/220600309. What's that supposed to mean? Huuh?!``

TextJPN: 「まぁ、ちょっとは冗談だって」
TextENG: ``Come on, that's partially a joke.``

TextJPN: 「かなり本気ってことでしょうがっ！！」
TextENG: ``That means it's mostly serious!!``

TextJPN: 「あっはっはっ！@k@vS14/03/220300320.　だいたい、詩音が看護師なんて無理無理！@k@vS14/03/220300321.　看護師ってのはね、そりゃもう難しい試験と実習を経て、責任重大な仕事を昼夜問わずに頑張らなきゃいけない大変な仕事で…」
TextENG: ``Ahaha!@k@vS14/03/220300320. Besides, I can't imagine you as a nurse at all!@k@vS14/03/220300321. After all, nurses have to endure difficult exams and practical training. It's a tough job with a lot of responsibility, where you have to work hard day and night...``

TextJPN: 「大丈夫ですよ。@k@vS14/06/220600312.少なくともお姉よりは勉強も成績が上ですしね？」
TextENG: ``It'll be fine.@k@vS14/06/220600312. I'm at least better at studying than you are, Sis.``

TextJPN: 「むっ？　なら、問題出すよ。@k@vS14/03/220300323.ズバリ、アメリカの首都は？！」
TextENG: ``Oh? Then answer me this.@k@vS14/03/220300323. What is the capital of America?!``

TextJPN: 「ニューヨーク」
TextENG: ``New York.``

TextJPN: いや、違うだろ。ワシントンだろ。…そもそも、なんて低レベルな戦いをしてるんだ、お前たちは？　ホントに受験やる気あるのかっ？！
TextENG: No, that's wrong. It's Washington DC. And how long are you guys going to keep fighting these low-level battles? Are you guys seriously motivated to take your exams?!

TextJPN: たくさんの仲間たちに囲まれて。
TextENG: We're surrounded by so many friends.

TextJPN: 助けあい、助けられあって、@r少しずつゆっくりと、確実に進んでいく。
TextENG: By helping and being helped, slowly, little by little, we'll be able to move forward.

TextJPN: 誰かの幸せを思って。@rそしてその人も、@r私にそう思ってもらえるように。
TextENG: Thinking about someone's else happiness. And that same person thinking about mine, too.

TextJPN: …それから、これはとても嬉しいことなんだけど。
TextENG: ...By the way, there is something to rejoice about.

TextJPN: あの事件以来、沙都子の症状は飛躍的なほど快方に向かっているそうだ。
TextENG: Satoko's symptoms have dramatically improved since the incident.

TextJPN: 残念ながら、雛見沢症候群の研究プロジェクトは予定通り３年後に閉じられるとのことだったが…、
TextENG: Unfortunately, the Hinamizawa Syndrome research project is still scheduled to end in three years, as originally planned...

TextJPN: 沙都子の治療で得たノウハウとサンプルのおかげで、完璧ではないにせよ抜本的な治療となる手がかりが発見されそうだ。
TextENG: But thanks to the samples and data gained from Satoko's treatment, they're likely to find enough clues to lead to a powerful, if not perfect, treatment regimen.

TextJPN: このままうまくいけば、プロジェクトが閉じる前にこの風土病も根絶することができるかも、と監督は嬉しそうに語っていた。
TextENG: The coach was happy to say that if things go well, they might be able to eradicate the disease before the project comes to a close.

TextJPN: それぞれが、@r自分の道を見つけて、@r歩き出して。
TextENG: Each of us,@rfinding the right path@rand walking down it.

TextJPN: そして進む先には、@r小さいけれど強く、@r確かな輝き。
TextENG: And the path ahead@rmay be narrow, but it's strong@rand it's definitely bright.

TextJPN: ――そう、@r希望があった。
TextENG: Yes...@rthere was still hope.

TextJPN: …ちょっとだけ熱気に火照った身体を冷やそうと、私はみんなの輪から外れて木陰に腰掛けた。
TextENG: ...My head was getting heated, so I tried to cool myself off by stepping away from the group and sitting in the shade.

TextJPN: 本当に、楽しい仲間たち。
TextENG: They really are such fun friends.

TextJPN: 本当に、愉快な毎日。
TextENG: I really am having a wonderful time, every single day.

TextJPN: それは、すべて。
TextENG: And each of those

TextJPN: 私たちが手に入れた、何にも代えがたくて貴重な、私たちのための宝物だった。
TextENG: is a precious, irreplaceable treasure we've attained.

TextJPN: ねぇ、羽入。
TextENG: Hey, Hanyuu?

TextJPN: 見えるかしら。
TextENG: Can you see this?

TextJPN: みんなの笑顔が。
TextENG: Everyone is smiling.

TextJPN: ねぇ、羽入。
TextENG: Hey, Hanyuu?

TextJPN: 聞こえるかしら。
TextENG: Can you hear this?

TextJPN: みんなの楽しそうな声が。
TextENG: It sounds like everyone is having fun.

TextJPN: あなたは、私のそばにもういない。
TextENG: You are no longer by my side.

TextJPN: それを思うと、まだ、寂しくて悲しい。
TextENG: Thinking about that still makes me sad and lonely.

TextJPN: でもね、羽入。
TextENG: But, Hanyuu.

TextJPN: この世界は、あなたのおかげで手に入れることができた世界。
TextENG: We were only able to reach this world thanks to you.

TextJPN: そしてあなたが気づかせてくれたから、みんなで守ることができた世界。
TextENG: And because you made us notice, we were all able to protect this world.

TextJPN: だから、この世界に私が生きている限り。
TextENG: So, as long as I go on living in this world.

TextJPN: 私は、あなたを忘れない。
TextENG: I'll never forget you.

TextJPN: そしてあなたも、この世界からいなくなったことにはならない。
TextENG: And this doesn't mean you're gone from this world.

TextJPN: そうでしょう、――羽入？
TextENG: Right... Hanyuu?

TextJPN: だって、あなたはずっと、私と一緒にいたのだから。
TextENG: Because you've been with me all this time.

TextJPN: そして、これからも、きっと……。
TextENG: And even going forward, I'm sure...

TextJPN: もちろんなのですよ、梨花…。
ふいに。
TextENG: Suddenly.

TextJPN: 風が通り過ぎた瞬間。
TextENG: The moment a breeze blew by.

TextJPN: 羽入のそんな声が、聞こえたような気がした。
TextENG: I felt like I could hear Hanyuu's voice.

TextJPN: …羽入。
TextENG: ...Hanyuu.

TextJPN: あなたの姿を見れなくなって、とても寂しい。
TextENG: It's so lonely now that I can no longer see you.

TextJPN: あなたの声を聞けなくなって、とても悲しい。
TextENG: It's so sad now that I can no longer hear you.

TextJPN: でも私は、心に決めたの。
TextENG: But deep in my heart, I've decided.

TextJPN: あなたの願った、私の幸せを。
TextENG: You wished for my happiness.

TextJPN: あなたの望んだ、私の喜びを。
TextENG: You wanted me to feel joy.

TextJPN: 同じようにたくさんの人に、それを願いたい。
TextENG: And like you, I wish for so many other people's joy, too.

TextJPN: 私の、大切な人たちの幸せと喜びを、ずっとずっと祈っていきたい。
TextENG: I want to forever pray for the happiness of the people dear to me.

TextJPN: それが、古手の家に生まれた者の、役目――いいえ。
TextENG: That's the role of those born into the Furude family... No.

TextJPN: あなたが愛してくれた古手梨花が、あなたの誇りとしてできる、一番の生き方だと思うから――。
TextENG: I think that's the best way for the Rika Furude you loved to go on living a life you can be proud of...

TextJPN: 「あ、やっと監督が来ましたよー！@k@vS14/06/220600315.　おーい！」
TextENG: ``Oh, the coach is finally here!@k@vS14/06/220600315. Heeey!``

TextJPN: 「一体なんでございますかねぇ？@k@vS14/04/220400278.　快気祝いにプレゼントなんて…」
TextENG: ``What on earth is this?@k@vS14/04/220400278. Did you bring a present for our celebration of health...?``

TextJPN: ……そう、@rひぐらしのなく頃に――。
TextENG: ...Yes,@rwhen the higurashi cry...

TextJPN: 深く、暗くて、@rあまりにも長かった悲しい運命が、@r@vS14/05/220500564.ようやく終わりを告げたことを@r私は、そして私たちは。
TextENG: This deep, dark, and sad fate@rthat went on far too long@r@vS14/05/220500564.has finally come to an end@rfor me, and for all of us.

TextJPN: 今この瞬間に……@rそれを、かみしめていた――。
TextENG: At this very moment...@rThat was all I could think about.

TextJPN: 「……ただいま……」
TextENG: ...I'm back...
